alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Lake County; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County; Southern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 12:26PM PST until January 13 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM PST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Del Norte County, Humboldt County, Southwest Trinity, Mendocino County, and Northwest Lake. * WHEN...From 10 PM PST this evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rain will spread across the late tonight through early Saturday. Peak rainfall rates are expected around sunrise Saturday. Rain will be most concentrated at high elevations along the coast. Widespread 12 hour rain totals of 3 to 6 inches are most likely. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Lake County; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County; Southern Trinity
